str2: Mildness, gentleness. From praus; mildness, i.e. humility.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From pais; to train up a child, i.e. Educate, or, discipline.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To set myself against, oppose. From anti and diatithemai; to set oneself opposite, i.e. Be disputatious.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From metanoeo; compunction; by implication, reversal (another's) decision).
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.
